newsitem.title: USA: Marathon lowers most u.s. posted crude 25cts.
newsitem.headline: Marathon lowers most u.s. posted crude 25cts.

text.p: Marathon Oil said it cut the price it will pay for U.S. crude oil by 25 cents a barrel, effective Friday.
The decrease brings the new price for U.S. benchmark grade West Texas Intermediate to $21.50 a barrel, West Texas Sour to $20.15 a barrel and Oklahoma Sweet to $21.50.
Light Louisiana sweet crude remains unchanged at $19.50.
